Deciding that they must make a replacement, they look everywhere for something to use and try some very unusual options. Will the bell be ready for Chime Time?

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: When Tommy and Tallulah agree to babysit the spring chicks while Madame Au Lait tends to Mother Chicks hurt wing, they dont realise that how much of a handful the chicks will be. programme.desc: An unconscious driver bounces from the side rails to the median barrier.

programme.title: Border Security: Canadas Front Line
programme.desc: Work of customs and immigration officials, following procedures they use to protect their borders.

programme.title: Border Security: Canadas Front Line
programme.desc: Work of customs and immigration officials, following procedures they use to protect their borders.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Follow Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the countrys various quarantine, customs, immigration and finance laws.

programme.title: Border Patrol
programme.desc: New Zealands Customs officers attempt to enforce the law and keep New Zealands borders safe from harm.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Follow Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the countrys various quarantine, customs, immigration and finance laws.

programme.title: Stargate Atlantis
programme.desc: Zapped by a mysterious device left running by the Ancients, Rodney McKay begins to evolve into a super human. As McKay basks in his new found super power the team struggles to deal with the new Rodney, but envy quickly turns to concern when the team discovers that the machine actually results in the death of those that have used it. Is this the end for the Doc?

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: The SG-1 team find themselves trapped in a museum on a world that has yet to discover the secret of the Stargate. Their plan to wait for Stargate command to send help is cut short when they are discovered and mistaken for a militant group of rebels. As an army builds outside the museum, the team decides to pretend they are in fact the rebels they have been accused of being.

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: An identity-stealing alien switches places with Paris, then takes command of Voyager after assuming Janeways identity.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Enterprise goes to the rescue of an unknown colony, but is informed that evacuation would destroy the perfection of its genetically engineered society.

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: While escorting Gul Dukat to his war crimes investigation, Sisko and the mentally disturbed Cardassian are stranded on a distant planet.

programme.title: FBI: Most Wanted
programme.desc: When a federal judge and his wife are shot dead in New York, the task force goes on the hunt and finds a connection to a man who is hours away from being executed in Missouri; Remy and Hana both grapple with being single and living alone.

programme.title: FBI: International
programme.desc: After a U.S. intelligence negotiator goes missing and her ransacked Paris apartment is discovered to be covered in her blood, the team is on the clock to find her before the countrys nuclear secrets fall into the wrong hands.

programme.title: Grimm
programme.sub-title: Nobody Knows the Trubel Ive Seen
programme.desc: Adalind tries to ensure the safety of her child by making a new alliance.

programme.title: Wynonna Earp
programme.desc: The apparition of Purgatorys blade-wielding barber, whom the Doc drowned several years ago, is at large and begins haunting Wynonna. With the penance-obsessed revenant on the rampage, will Waverly forgive Wynonna her self-centredness in time to save their necks?

programme.title: Night Cops
programme.desc: Cameras follow Kents Armed Response Unit as they deal with a man thought to be carrying a gun. Plus, Wrexham police follow up on intelligence concerning a drug dealer and officers in Exmouth encounter a drunken girl who blames her boozy antics on her recent boob job.

programme.title: Brit Cops: Frontline Crime UK
programme.desc: Action-packed documentary following Britains police. From the pursuit of a drink driver to an escalating domestic dispute, cops in west Wales have their work cut out.

programme.title: Africas Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The Drakensberg mountain range proves to be a tough home for its inhabitants. The animals there must endure the highest peaks to the rolling grassland.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Muellers gibbons Adidas and Dalumie head for the treetops for the first time, while Peanut, Pung-Yo and Tien, the endangered golden-cheeked gibbons, move into the enclosure next door. Plus, a specialist doctor is called in when Freddys bowel complaint fails to improve.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison Cronin travels to Monkey Worlds new endangered primate sanctuary in Vietnam, and meets the newest resident of the centre, Ellie the young golden-cheeked gibbon. Meanwhile, the team learn that two rare monkeys are being kept in a theme park outside Ho Chi Minh City, and attempt to get them freed.

programme.title: Undiscovered Vistas
programme.desc: On the western coast of Newfoundland, Gros Morne National Park is a place of awe-inspiring natural beauty. Gros Morne is a paradise for hikers with a Mars-like terrain,the result of an earth-fracturing collision of continents nearly 500 million years ago.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: A look at the wildlife of Brazil.

programme.title: Planet Weird
programme.desc: Discover how weirdness is baked into some animals DNA from birth. Check out the bowerbirds mate-attracting dance moves, the Christmas Island crabs traffic-dodging prowess, and the sockeye salmons uphill swimming skills.

programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the evolving understanding of whales, how much they have in common with humans, and how recent discoveries could help to better protect them from threats in an increasingly changing world.

programme.desc: Colonel ONeill encounters a strange man who has inexplicably intimate knowledge of the Stargate program.

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: Tealc and ONeill are sent hurtling into space when their test flight of a Goauld death glider goes awry.

programme.title: Whale with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the evolving understanding of whales, how much they have in common with humans, and how recent discoveries could help to better protect them from threats in an increasingly changing world.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grandpa Simpson inherits $106,000 from a woman he falls for at his rest home.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge paints for the first time since a teacher discarded her Ringo Starr portraits.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny is on red alert when a coma patient and key witness in his last HPD case before joining Five-0 shows signs of waking.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: He Keu Na Ka Alae a Hina
programme.desc: McGarrett gets word that someone is plotting a terror attack on Oahu, meanwhile, Chin and Abby face a decision.

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: SWAT hunt for a militant group that plans to execute the citys politicians. Street gets a break in his search for his missing mum.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When NCIS investigates a shootout on a boat in which a rare cultural artefact is stolen, theyre shocked to learn who owns the boat.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: While Bart runs for class president, Lisa falls for her substitute teacher.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: One snowy day in Springfield, Lisa informs Bart that she and Maggie share a bond that Bart will never understand because he doesnt have a brother. Bart makes his way to the orphanage to try and find one.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Following the interactions of office employees at paper company Dunder Mifflins Scranton branch.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Robert challenges the Dunder Mifflin staffers to double their sales. Andy decides to create an incentive program, but might end up regretting his promise.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: After Homer gets drunk at a party and leers at Maude Flanders, Marge forces him to accompany her on a marriage counselling weekend at a wooded retreat. Unfortunately, Homer is more interested in catching a legendary local catfish than working on his marriage. Back in Springfield, Bart and Lisa throw a party.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Three Men and a Comic Book
programme.desc: Bart, Milhouse and Martin pool their resources to buy the first-ever edition of the `Radioactive Man comic, but refusing to trust each other, they spend a stormy night together with it in the treehouse.

programme.title: This Christmas
programme.desc: Following Adam and Emma on their daily commute from the village of Langton to London, where they meet the same passengers every day.

programme.title: Tom Davis: Underdog
programme.desc: Tom Davis performs his sell-out stand-up show about living a life as the underdog, having gone from building sites to blockbuster success while still getting told he is punching by a waiter.

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Larry David once again offers an unsparing look at his inability to cope with life. In the opening episode, Marty Funkhouser, cashing in on Larrys empty gesture regarding his mentally ill sister, and Susies dinner party invitation protocols land Jeff in a sticky situation. Fearing the results of Lorettas biopsy, Larry wants to quickly break up with her to avoid having to care for her should it come back positive.

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Larry urges Loretta to see a doctor who advocates dumping `toxic spouses in the hope that shell ditch him. Later, Larrys attempt to do a favour for Leon backfires when he accidentally tells Leons friend that Leon has been sleeping with his wife.

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series following the 999 work of Greater Manchester Police. Englands second largest police force, its responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.

programme.desc: The Proactive unit track down a stolen Mercedes and chase after a disqualified driver.

programme.title: The Killer You Know
programme.desc: Most homicides are committed by someone familiar, a spouse, a co-worker, or a jealous ex. Each gripping episode in this series examines three shocking stories.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.sub-title: Mandy Stavik: The Case No One Could Forget
programme.desc: Stavik was just 18 when she disappeared after going out for a run. Her body was found three days later in the Nooksack River in Washington state.

programme.title: Facing Evil
programme.desc: When a gang of teenagers approaches the Texan home of Debbie Fleming, she shoots a 16-year-old boy.

programme.title: Facing Evil
programme.desc: Mother of two Susan Bailey is found dead in her home with 27 stab wounds. Susans 17-year-old daughter and her boyfriend may have something to do with this crime.

programme.title: Facing Evil
programme.desc: A custody battle gets out of control when the father is shot and killed. His ex-wife pleads guilty.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Murder by the Sea
programme.desc: Examining some of the most terrifying murders which took place at British seaside resorts: locations which, despite their associations with carefree holidaymaking, have also played host to the most remarkable crimes.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.sub-title: The Case Against Brooke Skylar Richardson
programme.desc: The parents of Brooke Skylar Richardson speak out. The real story behind the international headlines in the case of an alleged unthinkable crime.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: The bodies of a woman and her son are found in a field. Insects found on the bodies and a suspicious blond hair help to track down the killer.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Delving into the murky world of forensic investigations with the case of an anonymous letter, sent to the police with information about a murder. When the nature of the information arouses suspicion about the sender, laser technology is used to trace the city, street and office number from where it was sent.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A decomposed body is found in a barrel, and a dilapidated address book may hold the answer.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Marie Robards lost her father, and one year later, her moving performance in a high school play revealed she was harbouring a dark secret.

programme.title: Murder by the Sea
programme.desc: Examining some of the most terrifying murders which took place at British seaside resorts: locations which, despite their associations with carefree holidaymaking, have also played host to the most remarkable crimes.

programme.title: Murder by the Sea
programme.desc: When Michael Barber finds his wife Susan in bed with another man, she realises she has to take drastic measures to stop him leaving, but no one could suspect how far she would go.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: A rare look inside a murder case where virtually everything from the first moments of the investigation through the verdict are captured on camera.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a policemans home is burned to the ground, he later arrests a man who confesses to the arson, but the confession is dubious.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a young boy is killed in a mysterious fire, his mother is charged with arson, but shes determined to extinguish the accusations.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a pregnant woman was attacked, her unborn child was killed. She accused her husband, who spent years in jail until new DNA evidence emerged.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a man dies unexpectedly in the office of a noted California doctor, police begin what they think will be a routine investigation. What they find throws doubt on the identity of the dead man and raises questions about the doctors role.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A young renter says his retainer was damaged when his landlady threw his property off a balcony; a schoolmates grandmother accuses an 11-year-old of breaking the rear window of her car.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Teens fight over a missing laptop; after a car catches fire and explodes, the driver parked next to the disaster sues for damages to her own vehicle.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A woman sues her childs father for his share of the boys orthodontist bill; a woman says she never asked to be bailed out of jail, so she does not owe her former friend for her loan.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Lying to Police?; Concert Ticket Snafu
programme.desc: A man sues for defamation of character after a friend calls the police saying he stole her car; a woman sues her ex-boyfriend for repayment of loans.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Smoking Pills and Check Fraud; Mother vs. Daughter
programme.desc: Former drug-buddies fight over the cashing of fraudulent checks; mother and daughter feud over repayment of a loan, utility bills and car damages.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A man denies scamming a couple who tried to buy a car from him.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Slashed Tires; Smoke Bomb!; Illegal Eviction?
programme.desc: A teen says his former friend slashed his tires; a woman accuses a man of setting off a smoke bomb in her van; a tenant says his landlord evicted him with only one days notice.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Taxing Friendship; Exes Fight Over Childs Bed
programme.desc: A person who received a bounced check is accused of using its routeing information to retrieve money illegally; a man demands that his ex-wife repay him for a bed he says he purchased for their son.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Theres only one Judge Judy! With her outspoken style and hard-hitting decisiveness, Judge Judy single-handedly sorts out family disputes and misdemeanours, one case at a time.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Babysitting Debacle; Unwed Parents Bitter Breakup; Shoplifting Among Friends
programme.desc: A man says he owes his former baby-sitter nothing, because she damaged his truck and her boyfriend stole property; parents feud over a false arrest and a restraining order; a woman sues a former friend after they were arrested for shoplifting.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Texas Exes; Drunk and Abusive?; Repeat Offender Drug Bailout
programme.desc: Exes feud over euthanising a dog and vandalizing a car; a man says his girlfriend refused to give him his belongings after she kicked him out of the home; a former friend wants repayment of bail money from a woman incarcerated four times.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Drinking and Driving House-Sitter?; Traffic Ticket Pile-Up; Threes a Crowd
programme.desc: A homeowner says a house sitter drank her wine, damaged her couch and crashed her car; a woman says she was falsely arrested for stealing her own car; two roommates insist that a third does not deserve to have her full security deposit returned.

programme.desc: A fight nearly breaks out in court when a young war veteran sues his former landlord. Then, a pit bulls owner says her dog-sitting ex-friend stole her autographed jersey.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: When Labradoodles Attack; The Art of Babysitting
programme.desc: A man says his neighbors labradoodles attacked him and his dog. Then, a baby sitter sues a father for fees and for art supplies she bought for his children.

programme.sub-title: Fit of Rage, Kicked Car; Character Party Disaster
programme.desc: A bus driver says a fellow motorist jumped on and kicked her car in a fit of rage. Then, an entertainment booker sues a clown for nonpayment of services.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Good Deed, Lost Truck; Dad Accused of Stealing From Teen
programme.desc: A 60-year-old man lends his truck to a stranger, who fails to return it. Then, a teen sues her estranged father for the return or value of a car.

programme.desc: Teens fight over who is at fault for a crash. Then, former friends argue about a loan and a restraining order.

programme.desc: An all-star comedy-mystery following on from `Murder on the Blackpool Express which focuses on Terry, Gemma, Mildred and friends on an eventful and bloody overnight ferry trip to Amsterdam.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The annual garden fete is of no interest to Compo and Clegg, until they meet a tramp with a special interest in donkeys.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Del, Rodney and Uncle Albert take their mates from the Nags Head on a disastrous day trip to Margate. A worried Cassandra is none too happy at Rodney joining the party having just celebrated their first anniversary.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Mythical creatures go bump in the night and unleash a comedy of errors. All is not well with Mrs Cakeworthys husband, events bring a shine to Boycies eyes, and Beths Christmas present opens the door to the promised land.

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Its Christmas in the nations favourite corner shop, but some of Granvilles most important customers have plans to leave town. Not only is Madge planning to take his beloved Mavis away for a Christmas break but is Mr Newbold also thinking of doing a runner, leaving Granville at the mercy of Mrs Featherstones amorous advances? Granville has to use some of his craftiest wiles to persuade everyone not to travel at Christmas.

programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring drills his platoon in physical fitness and assembles a choir to entertain the troops.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is a Mammy on a mission - trying to make sure grandson Bono isnt sent to the infamous local primary school (despite what his parents want) and as if her house isnt normally noisy enough, she finds herself lumbered with a brand new house guest in the form of a homeless parrot. At least shes got her New Years Eve party to look forward to - until her guests start dropping like flies. Suddenly it looks like she might be seeing in the New Year without her family around her.

programme.desc: Steve Coogans spoof chat show featuring his very own Frankensteins monster! programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits the village of Staithes in North Yorkshire and unearths its role in kickstarting the chemical industry in the north east of England.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson discovers how traditional boat building shaped the beautifully preserved village of Arnside on the banks of the River Kent in Lancashire.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits the picturesque Georgian village of Charlestown on the south west coast of Cornwall and learns how it wasshaped by the vision of one man.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: The small hamlet of Botallack was once at the centre of the Cornish tin and copper mining industry as archaeologist Ben Robinson discovers. By 1861, Botallacks mine was one of the biggest in the whole of Cornwall. Ben explores the villages mining past with archaeologist, Adam Sharpe, where he learns the mines produced millions and millions of pounds worth of copper and tin.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has sold everything from trucks to bicycles - but he cant remember the last time he auctioned off a two-seater plane.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: 100 motorbikes come in for auction from every era of the 20th century. Also, the team assess a 1965 Vanden Plas Princess with a four litre Rolls Royce engine thats seen better days.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: The Rise of the Aircraft Carrier
programme.desc: In December 1941, the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor. The attack brought America into World War II and changed the way battles were fought.

programme.title: World at War
programme.desc: As peace descends in 1945, the series ends with a sombre reminder of the human cost of the bloodiest conflict in history.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce is in a festive mood as she opens this seasonal selection box from the Roadshow team. The most talked-about finds of the year are updated as Fiona reveals what happened after the cameras stopped rolling. Stories featured include the remarkable discovery by a viewer of a lost brooch by Victorian designer William Burges after she saw an appeal on the show.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Hartland Abbey in Devon. Amongst the items catching their eyes are the World War II notebooks of a young plane spotter who may have witnessed Glenn Millers last flight, a collection of pottery used for making clotted cream and a colourful assortment of early surfboards.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Derek picks out a solid-looking 1969 MGB for the team to look out for at auction. After winning it is sent to a father-and-son team to restore.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Dave alerts the team to a 1979 Lotus Esprit S3. The car is a thoroughbred classic that desperately needs a proper restoration, but its also an expensive purchase that risks not paying off.

programme.title: War Factories

programme.desc: As peace descends in 1945, the series ends with a sombre reminder of the human cost of the bloodiest conflict in history.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Thousands flock to Hartland Abbey in North Devon as the experts search for more treasure. Discoveries brought to the cameras include a quilt believed to have been made from ball gowns worn in the royal household, a valuable silver bowl damaged by a V bomb in World War 2, a haunted painting, and one of the rarest pieces of pressed glass in the world, which is given a four-figure valuation.

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: During a cold snap Robbie gets iced in on the Grand Union Canal. Later, his parents pay a visit and help him through Marsworth Locks.

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson sets out on one of the worlds most iconic pilgrimages, the Camino de Santiago, in search of what makes this journey so meaningful to so many.

programme.title: Australia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve explores Australia. His adventure starts in the `red centre of the continent and onwards through South Australia via the extraordinary Indian Pacific Railway, until he reaches the west coast city of Perth. On the way, he joins an Aussie rancher in the parched outback and visits the lucrative tuna fishing city of Port Lincoln. Finally in Perth, Simon discovers a full scale British invasion.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Sitting on the east coast of Jersey, and about 14 miles from the coast of Normandy, the small village of Gorey was, for hundreds of years the frontline of defence between the British Isles and its enemy, the French. Archaeologist Ben Robinson follows the story of this small villages history as an important military location, from the castle built in the 1200s to the experiences of the village in the second world war when occupied by Hitlers army.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Situated on the eastern coast of the Isle of Man, the village of Laxey is known today as a tourist destination, but as archaeologist Ben Robinson finds out, it wasnt the beaches and the mountains that attracted Victorian tourists, but an engineering marvel - the biggest waterwheel in the world.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson takes us to the quiet village of Ravenglass, tucked away on the edge of the Lake Districts National Park, where he finds out about its strategic importance to the Roman empire. Ben explores the village and its surrounding area to uncover the remarkable evidence of its Roman past: unearthing Roman pottery, locating the earthworks of its fort and marvelling at one the best surviving examples of a Roman military bathhouse anywhere in Britain.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist, Ben Robinson visits the east coast village of Flamborough which sits on a rugged headland sticking out into the North Sea. A largely unassuming village today, it was once effectively cut off from the rest of the country by a five-metre-deep, two-and-a-half-mile long man-made dyke, re-enforced and fortified with local chalk. As Ben discovers when he visits two of the villages most prominent structures, chalk plays a large part in the history of Flamborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rusty 1970 Fiat 500 goes under the hammer - Derek reckons its the kind of vehicle that is so iconic that it has to be saved.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Tucked away in the showroom is a WW2-era Willys Jeep. Its original condition means there might be a bunfight for a military vehicle thats ripe for restoration.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: When people think of Skoda, they think of cheap and efficient family cars. As early as the 1930s, their factory was a cover for espionage, sabotage and the liberation of Jews from all over Europe.

programme.desc: Two spies turn double agents at the height of the Cold War standoff between East and West. Their deception happens as the superpowers edge towards nuclear war.

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Scotland to visit St Andrews University. programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit to Lulworth Castle in Dorset finds Fiona Bruce and the experts on another busy day of valuations. Antiques under scrutiny include the most valuable piece of furniture seen in a decade with an apothecary chest from the 10th century, a watch made for Luftwaffe pilots in World War Two, and a set of village stocks arrive for appraisal.
